result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Todd L. Borsuk is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

to revoke DPA
from Court on DPA

Defendant Todd L. Borsuk in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances and agreement.  State moves to amend Ct 1 to Misd. Battery/Domestic, Ct 2 to be dismissed.  DPA for 18 months is agreed upon.  Atty Lawton agrees and enters NC plea.  DE agrees.  Court grants amendment to Misd. Battery and questions DE on plea/accepts/defers adjudication for 18 months.  Review scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Plea hearing on February 23, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
No violent or abusive contact w/J.B.

Defendant Todd L. Borsuk in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Atty Lawton states they will waive prelim in 14CF352 and state will move to dismiss 14CF396.  Plea/sent to be set out in 14CF352 in Br 2.  State states agreement/amended charge in 14CF352 would be Misd. Battery/DA and Ct 2 dismissed w/DPA to be agreed upon for 18 months.  Atty Lawton is in agreement and notes the no contact in the bond would be dropped today as well.  DE is in agreement.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver in 14CF352/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  State moves to dismiss 14CF396.  Court dismisses 14CF396.  Parties to proceed w/arraignment on the next court date in 14CF352.  Court orders the no contact provision amended to "no violent/abusive contact" in the bond in 14CF352.

Defendant Todd L. Borsuk appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE does qualify for PD representation.  State requests $500.00 Cash bond.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $1000.00 Signature bond set.
